'''Skitty''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''エネコ''' ''Eneco'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Delcatty}} when exposed to a [[Moon Stone]].

==Biology==
Skitty is a pink, feline Pokémon with a stumpy body and four short legs. On its face is a cream-colored, crescent-shaped marking. It has slit-like eyes and tufted ears with purple interiors. Its slender tail has a bulky pink section at the end, terminated by three pin-like structures with yellow ball-like tips. In battle, its tail puffs out, and threatens opponents with a sharp growl.

It is fascinated by moving objects, and chases them. It is known to chase its own tail and become dizzy from it. Although it can be difficult to earn its trust, it is very popular due to its adorable looks and behavior. It can use the moves of other Pokémon through the use of {{m|Assist}}, its former [[signature move]]. It lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|holes in trees in forests.}}

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Skitty anime.png|250px|left|thumb|Skitty in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[May's Skitty]]=====
A Skitty appeared ''[[AG047|I Feel Skitty!]]'', where it was caught by {{an|May}}. It was particularly ditzy and mischievous, and it had a tendency of getting itself into trouble with other Pokémon.

=====Other=====
Skitty debuted in ''[[SS010|Big Meowth, Little Dreams]]'', in which {{MTR}} fell in love with one.

In ''[[AG060|Delcatty Got Your Tongue]]'', May met a former [[Grand Festival]] winner named [[Dr. Abby]], whose Skitty was shown in a flashback.

A Skitty appeared in a flashback in ''[[XY088|A Trip Down Memory Train!]]'', where it was among the group of Pokémon that befriended [[Clemont's Bunnelby]] when it was still a wild Pokémon.

====Minor appearances====
A Skitty appeared in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''.

A Skitty appeared in ''[[AG119|The Ribbon Cup Caper]]'' at the S.S. St. Flower's [[Pokémon Center]].

A Skitty appeared in ''[[AG158|Queen of the Serpentine!]]'' as one of {{FB|Pike Queen|Lucy}}'s pets.

A Skitty appeared in ''[[DP060|Journey to the Unown!]]''

A Skitty appeared in {{MTR}}'s fantasy in ''[[DP117|Noodles: Roamin' Off]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Skitty appeared in ''[[BW103|Curtain Up, Unova League!]]'' and ''[[BW105|Lost at the League!]]''.

Skitty made cameo appearances in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]'', ''[[XY003|A Battle of Aerial Mobility!]]'', ''[[XY005|A Blustery Santalune Gym Battle!]]'', ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]'', ''[[XY016|A Jolting Switcheroo!]]'', ''[[XY018|Awakening the Sleeping Giant]]'', ''[[XY022|Going for the Gold!]]'', and ''[[XY028|The Bonds of Evolution!]]''.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Poké Puff Contest]].

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY039|Summer of Discovery!]]'', ''[[XY041|Foggy Pokémon Orienteering!]]'', and ''[[XY042|Battling Into the Hall of Fame!]]''.

Two Skitty appeared in ''[[XY047|Dreaming a Performer's Dream!]]''.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY066|Confronting the Darkness!]]''.

Two Skitty appeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]'', each under the ownership of a different {{pkmn|Trainer}}.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY113|Performing a Pathway to the Future!]]''.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY116|The Synchronicity Test!]]''.

Three Skitty appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', with two belonging to Trainers and the third appearing in a flashback.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[XY136|Forming a More Perfect Union!]]''.

A Trainer's Skitty appeared in ''[[SM017|Crystal-Clear Sleuthing!]]''.

{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Kiki Skitty.png|thumb|200px|Skitty in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
{{main|Kiki}}
Kiki was one of {{adv|Ruby}}'s [[starter Pokémon|first Pokémon]] along with [[Nana]] and [[Rara]] and first appeared in ''[[PS181|	Creeping Past Cacnea]]''. She is used in the {{OBP|Cute|condition}} category of [[Pokémon Contest]]s and, like the rest of {{cat|Ruby's Pokémon|his Pokémon}}, is a really powerful {{pkmn|battle}}r. She evolved into a Delcatty after accidentally being exposed to a Moon Stone on [[Steven Stone]]'s belt.

A student's Skitty appeared in ''[[PS530|Movie Panic]]''.

{{adv|Shauna}} owns a Skitty, nicknamed Kitty, that first appeared in ''[[PAXY01|An X-cuse to Come Out and Play]]'', where it was seen with its Trainer in [[Vaniville Town]] watching {{adv|Y}}'s failed attempt to get {{adv|X}} out of his house. Kitty and the others managed to escape from the town during {{p|Xerneas}} and {{p|Yveltal}}'s rampage, and has since then been traveling with its trainer and her friends.

==Trivia==
* Skitty's inclusion in the {{egg3|Field}} inspired the {{Appendix|Fan terminology#HSOWA|Hot Skitty on Wailord Action}} joke.
* The [[Fluffy Tail]] item resembles Skitty's tail.
* Skitty is the only {{cat|Generation III Pokémon}} that evolves via Moon Stone.

===Origin===
Skitty is based on a {{wp|kitten}} with its tail resembling {{wp|Foxtail (diaspore)|foxtail grass}} or a pin holder.

====Name origin====
Skitty is a combination of ''skittish'' and ''kitty'' (slang for ''{{wp|cat}}'').

Eneco is a combination of 狗尾草 ''enokorogusa'' ({{wp|Foxtail (diaspore)|foxtail grass}}, a type of plant that Skitty's tail resembles) and 猫 ''neko'' (cat).
